title: Worked Solution
text:
To solve this equation, we need to get all the terms with q on one side of the equation and all the constants on the other side.
First, we can start by simplifying the left side of the equation:
$$8\left(q+1ight)-5=8q+8-5$$
$$=8q+3$$
Now let's simplify the right side of the equation:
$$3(2q-4)-1=6q-12-1$$
$$=6q-13$$
Now we have:
$$8q+3=6q-13$$
